message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD). Escitalopram is an SSRI that can be used for long term management of GAD. Diazepam and Risperidone are for short term use and may cause dependence and addiction. No treatment recommended may lead to worsening anxiety symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting signs of generalized anxiety disorder and medication is recommended. Among the options, Escitalopram is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor commonly used to treat anxiety disorders. Diazepam is a benzodiazepine used for short-term anxiety relief, while Risperidone is an antipsychotic used for treating schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. No treatment recommended is not a viable option as the patient's symptoms are interfering with daily activities.
